column15: What is your annual household income?
column16: What was your overall impression of this event (quality, lighting, sound, value)?
column17: Please share any other suggestions or ideas that would help us enhance your experience at Gesa Power House Theatre. If you would like someone to respond to your feedback, please include your contact information. Thank you!

None: it was brilliantly conceived, directed, and executed.
A great performance.

column16: Excellent! It was powerful and very well done in every respect.
Loved it!  Talent and expertise right here in Walla Walla.  Would attend any play that Nancy Simon directs and Tim Golden participates.  What a voice and important story!
Impressive, extremely relevant, a very powerful play to an appreciative packed house. The sound, staging and lobby setup were very professional and made the experience enjoyable.
column17: The one element I would recommend is to turn the lights over the audience off.  If that is not possible because of safety regulations, at least they could be dimmed down to a level comfortable to be able to focus on the stage.

column16: It was an exceptional performance of a riveting play.  The set and stage direction enhanced the play.  The sound was a bit muffled a few times.  I was in the second row.  It was chilly, but I expected that so brought a jacket.
The play was fantastic and the actor was perfect for the role.

column17: We appreciated being able to attend an AFTERNOON performance as we live 40 miles away and do not drive after dark.  Thank you!

column16: Wonderful!  Wish more people had been there.
column17: I was nearby when an older lady fell.  Staff was so great in dealing with the situation.  Found them seats more compatible with the woman’s needs and brought ice packs!   Kudos to staff!

column16: Loved it! Tim was great and we'd been really looking forward to this performance.

Was impressed with the ability of the sole performer, Tim Golden, to execute the play for two hours straight without any breaks.  That's an arduous task considering the intensity of the subject matter.  This is a good way to open lines of communication and fulfill the need to educate people regarding the lack of equity for the black community.
column17: Would have appreciated the house lights not shining directly at me throughout the event.  Made it difficult to watch the performer on stage as the glare was a bit overwhelming.  I had to keep my head down for a good portion of the play.  Despite that, it was good experience.  Many thanks to the Director, Nancy Simon, for bringing this to the Powerhouse.

column16: Sterling event with a magnetic and brilliant performer; left with my brain fully engaged. No intermissions and the time flew. Everything worked wonderfully--thank you!

Great show. Good value, good logistics and a little known story that’s important to hear. 
Well done.
Wonderful!  Enjoyed the music, lighting, sound.  The artist was exceptional!
